title: Business Solutions Analyst
description:
About Us


Healthcare today is nothing short of amazing. Yet all of it only works when people connect with it. And too often, they don’t. Healthcare can be impersonal. Confusing. All elbows. The record scratch at life’s party. We’re here to help connect healthcare with the people who need it. Which is everyone. How? By listening. Collaborating. And inspiring.

Icario is the leading health action company that deeply understands people, giving our clients the data and tools they need to reach further, overcome barriers, personalize outreach, and connect with people like they’re human. Using whole person data, behavioral science, and digital-first omnichannel pathways, we build long-term value for our customers by helping them put people first and deliver better outcomes faster. This is healthcare that knows us, meets us where we are, has a relationship with us, anticipates our needs, and smoothly and consistently connects us with the right care. This is healthcare that helps everyone live better. Ultimately, our mission is to help move people to do things that are good for them! We’re excited about the path ahead—are you ready to make the world a healthier place, one person at a time?
About the Role


Does the idea of playing a significant role in a cutting-edge SaaS platform that is launching at a fast-growing, late-stage start-up sound like your jam? Are you looking for an organization where your expertise and experience can grow and allow you to be innovative? If so, we’ve got an opportunity with your name written all over it!

We are seeking an experienced Business Solutions Analyst (BSA) to join our Client Operations team. The BSA plays a vital role in the definition and successful execution of continuous improvement projects. Your main objective is to help us enhance our ways of working and improve our ability to delight customers. This will be accomplished because you are willing to dive deep into the way things are done in order to suggest improvements and new business procedures to create a better customer experience.

This role will require both project management and continuous improvement skills, in addition to the ability to influence results through others.  

Why We Need You


Icario wants to provide the best possible experience for both our employees and our clients. In order to do that, we need investigative problem-solvers to help lead improvements in the way we work.
  

  

*Primary Responsibilities*
* Assist with the development of operations tools, processes, and standards
* Continuously review how things are done and recommend improvements
* Effectively lead and manage continuous improvement projects (DMAIC or other)
* Act as a change agent that institutionalizes a continuous improvement culture.
* Act as a facilitator for continuous improvement activities
* Monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, escalating issues, publishing progress reports and recommending actions
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including operations, engineering, product, and sales, to understand complex issues
* Develop and maintain documentation, including job aids, process maps and best practices
* Additional duties as assigned
* Embody Icario’s values

  

  

What We'll Love About You


At Icario, we’re not looking for the impossible, just the exceptional. This position’s responsibility is to provide an easy and reliable experience for our clients and client facing team members to provide issue resolution and product expertise. Successful team members will have excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to approach resolving issues generously. The ability to document user feedback as well as a bias towards action are essential.  

  

*Required Qualifications:*
* 2+ years of experience managing projects
* Creative, flexible, positive problem-solver who takes initiative and practices extreme ownership
* Excellent facilitator with proven written and verbal communication skills
* Experience with collecting and communicating scope from complex and/or ambiguous opportunities
* Excels and succeeds in environments of ambiguity, changing priorities, and rapid iteration
* Ability to establish trust with stakeholders, build relationships, and ensure alignment across internal functions to enable better collaboration and positive outcomes
* Communication excellence
* Intermediate proficiency with MS Office (Including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint)
* Ability to travel up to 10% of the time (Domestic)
* Ability to work any 8-hour shift between the hours of 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM CST from Monday – Friday
* Associate’s Degree (or higher) OR equivalent work experience


*Preferred Qualifications:*
* Lean Six Sigma, TQM or experience with other problem-solving methodology

What You'll Love About Us


* 4+ weeks PTO, Summer PTO, and unlimited Health & Wellness PTO
* Competitive benefits package including: medical, dental, vision, disability, FSA, HSA, pet insurance, and more
* Generous 401k program with company match
* Company paid parental leave
* Work-life harmony
* $1,000 employee referral bonus program
* Fully remote & hybrid working models with office locations in Minneapolis, MN & Birmingham, AL
* The list goes on, apply to learn more!


  

**JOIN US**
Want to learn more about us? Visit us at icariohealth.com.
  

Icario is committed to fostering a welcoming, accessible, respectful, and inclusive environment that ensures equal access and participation for people with disabilities. Please let us know if you require any accommodations by emailing careers@icariohealth.com
  

Icario is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Employer. Women, minorities, veterans, and individuals with disabilities as well as all other qualified individuals are encouraged to apply. We strive to empower an inclusive workplace culture that maximizes every employee’s contribution, widens the leadership pipeline, and ultimately increases the quality of our ideas, products, and our collective mindset. The intersection of opinions and experiences is made stronger by the power of diverse voices, ideas, and perspectives. By championing diversity and inclusion in our workforce and workplace culture, we’re helping ensure we can meet the challenges of the future. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
About Icario


In 2020, Revel + NovuHealth joined forces to create Icario because we knew we could do better together—creating value by uniting pioneering technology, data science, and behavioral insights to make the world a healthier place, one person at a time.  

There is an island in the Aegean Sea where people live extremely long lives. They’re happy, too. Families are close. They eat well. They exercise. And they stay connected with each other, and not just by smartphone. This got us thinking. What if we apply what we learn from the Blue Zone island of Ikaria (our namesake), add pioneering technology and exabytes of data, and help healthcare connect better with everyone? We’ll have a lot more healthy, happy people, and that’s a pretty good thing.  

As an organization, we’re a collaborative team of pioneers, inventors, and systems thinkers. We speak truth, are driven by data, and sweat the details. We’re a friendly and easygoing group, but we work hard because we are mission-driven, we know a better way, and we’re here to make it happen.

title: Sr Business Analyst
description:
**About this Role**
===================



Fandom is growing! Our Sr Business Analyst opportunity is based in the United States, and reports to our VP Corporate Development.



Our team is a fan of all things entertainment and games. As a Sr Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in driving key decisions for Fandom. In this role, you will work closely with business & technical stakeholders across various functional teams (marketing, product, tech, revenue, c-suite, etc) to support measurement needs for brands like Fandom, GameSpot, and Metacritic. You will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and transforming complex business data into actionable insights. Your expertise will contribute to strategic planning and overall business success.


**You Will Own…**
=================


**Explore and interpret Fandom's data**


* Conduct in-depth analysis of internal and external data sources to extract meaningful insights.
* Develop and maintain comprehensive dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide actionable intelligence to stakeholders.
* Collaborate with business leaders to understand information needs and deliver relevant, timely, and accurate reports.
* Own a databook: build, maintain and improve an externally-focused reporting package


**Continuous Improvement**


* Find improvements: improve our new product launch and goal setting processes
* Keep us competitive: monitor and benchmark us against competitors
* Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in business intelligence and analytics.


**Drive change through collaboration and data-based insights**


* Lead meetings and influence C-level stakeholders
* Work closely with the Corporate Development team to provide data-driven insights that support strategic planning, and other business development initiatives.

**You Have...**
===============


* 5+ years overall experience
* Internet advertising industry expertise (understanding of how internet usage is measured and how advertising revenue is delivered and earned)
* Productive with broad directions
* Proficiency in query and scripting languages as well as databases and common data analytics platforms and tools (e.g., Amplitude, BigQuery, Google Analytics, Qlik, SQL, XSLT)
* Proficiency in Google Sheets, Docs and Slides

**Bonus Points...**
===================


* Industry understanding of movies, TV, and gaming
* An investment banking or consulting background

**Benefits & Perks**
====================


* Salary Range = ($94k - $165k)
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision
* Training (unlimited Udemy + more)
* Flexible working hours and time off
* Equity & Retirement Programs including 401K match
* Paid Parental Leave

**About Fandom**
================



Fandom is the world's largest fan platform where fans immerse themselves in imagined worlds across entertainment and gaming. Reaching more than 350 million unique visitors per month and hosting more than 250,000 wikis, Fandom is the #1 source for in-depth information on pop culture, gaming, TV and film, where fans learn about and celebrate their favorite fandoms. Fandom's Gaming division manages the online video game retailer Fanatical. Fandom Productions, the content arm of Fandom, enhances the fan experience through curated editorial coverage and branded content from trusted and established publishing brands Gamespot, TV Guide and Metacritic, along with its Emmy-nominated Honest Trailers and the weekly video news program The Loop. For more information follow @getfandom or visit: www.fandom.com.

  


**Fandom is an equal opportunity employer. Fandom values diversity, and all employment decisions are made on the basis of job requirements and individual qualifications.**

title: SharePoint Business Analyst
description:
**Roles and Responsibilities:**

* Work cross-functionally with business owners to understand requirements and translate them into design specifications
* Analyze and research Legal and GR team's informational needs to assure content is clear and up-to-date
* Develop and maintain department intranet sites, pages, and tools, including SharePoint, MS O365, and our hybrid site builder platforms
* Manage data retention tasks related to Legal and GR teams
* Create and update training and procedures to support all teams within the department
* Complete special projects and content sharing initiatives between the Office suite of products and SharePoint
* Plan and implement site, page, and tool builds including content creation
* Craft easy to follow user documentation and procedures to support Legal and GR teams' usage of the intranet sites
* Apply search tuning to all content as needed
* Identify and troubleshoot day-to-day issues related to tools, permissions, and training

**Skills and Qualifications:**

* At least 5 years of administration experience with SharePoint Online and Power Platform
* A continuous improvement mindset and well versed in standard improvement methodologies
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to individuals at all levels of the organization
* Demonstrable experience in SharePoint Online/Office 365, Power Apps, Power Automate, Workflows, and Forms
* Hands-on experience with migrations (SharePoint to SharePoint, content migrations, and other Legacy Systems to SharePoint) using migration tools like DocAve, and Sharegate
* Knowledge of building and tuning search for all content
* Solid understanding of content sharing and co-authoring standard methodologies between the Office suite of products and SharePoint
* Extensive experience planning and implementing site, page and tool builds including content creation
* Highly motivated and able to work with minimal supervision, adaptable to changes as needed
* Helpful to have experience in Captivate, Camtasia, or any training video tool

**Expectations:**

* Champion intranet best practices and keep the content current and relevant for Legal and Government Relations team members
* Train, coach, and support content creators and site administrators
* Implement effective security controls through site permissions to safeguard against possible incidents in our intranet environment
* Document design and content administration best practices to support collaboration and spreadability

Able to create and modify procedures to solve complex issues. Seen as a subject matter expert within functional area. Participates in negotiation and collaboration. Utilizes creative thinking and innovative approaches involving multiple technologies. Supports initiatives that focus on meeting and growing business needs. Monitors service performance to SLAs and ensures organizational and leadership visibility of SLA performance and problem areas. Manages support exceptions/escalations and where appropriate, creates new or refines existing business processes. Possesses knowledge to plan and manage service deliveries for standard and customized IT solutions and processes to satisfy customer and business requirements.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $50.00 - $52.00 per hour

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Business Analyst
description:
At GMS- Government Market Strategies, we believe success is more than meeting short-term objectives; it's about strategic foresight, innovative planning, and a relentless commitment to growth. Our approach goes beyond maintaining the status quo or hitting revenue targets – it's about envisioning the full potential of our clients and helping them embrace transformative change.


**Our Philosophy:**


We understand that thriving in today's dynamic business landscape requires careful consideration of both internal and external factors. Retaining and expanding business demand is more than just a plan; it demands a customer-focused design and a detailed growth strategy.

  

Government Market Strategies is seeking a Business Analyst to serve as a member of its consulting


& professional services team in support of a large government contractor and the development and


execution of its strategic growth plan.


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES**


* Provide business focused objective advice, expertise and specialist skills to support the


development of the client's strategic plan.


* Conduct qualitative and quantitative analysis in support of strategic planning, solution


architecture, and business proposal / acquisition management.


* Facilitate and support the identification and development of methods, plans, and


documentation to streamline operating procedures, reports and systems to improve


operations, achieve savings, and encourage long-range planning to assure results.


* Support the development of business plans, procedural documentation, and other


deliverables in support of the client specific needs.


**MINIMUM SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS**


* 1-4 years professional/related experience


* Proactive, independent worker who thrives in both a team and independently


* Demonstrates strong problem-solving capability


* Basic understanding of how technology supports business


* Experience/familiarity with the federal acquisitions process preferred


* Strong communication skills - verbal and written


* Ability to lead and facilitate client meetings and events, conference calls, and capture


accurate meeting notes


* MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, Visio


**ADDITIONAL DESIRED SKILLS**


* Ability to manage a small team as needed


* Strong quantitative analysis skills


* Ability to organize, analyze, and present data as meaningful information to business leaders


* MS Excel: v-lookups, pivot tables, data validation, and analysis using graphs and charts


**REQUIRED EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS**


* Bachelors in degree required (Business, Finance/Accounting, Information Systems, or


related)

title: Business Analyst I-III
description:
**InfoAge Solutions, Inc. (IAS)** is a full-service Information Technology Company with offices in Virginia, Maryland, and Washington DC with over 20 years' experience specializing in using technology to help government and businesses achieve success. IAS focuses in Security Management, Infrastructure Hosting, and Business Process Management. IAS' Business Technology Program offers an All-Inclusive Technology Program designed to help smaller organizations professionally enhance their operations by providing a virtual CIO and technology infrastructure. IAS has provided enterprise IT management expertise for the Department of Homeland Security, Oracle Corporation, Deloitte & Touché, State of Maryland, and many other public and private organizations building over 1700 systems for every type of business need. We have the experience to help our clients meet their business goals by combining 'Best Practices' with 'proven technology' to deliver real solutions.


Founded in 2001, IAS is a leading IT, Security Management, Business Consulting firm committed to helping clients succeed. We have the resources, expertise, and dedicated professionals needed to achieve results for our clients. This is a great opportunity to join a winning team.

**Position Description**
========================


Minimum 5+ years' experience. The Business Analyst will evaluate IT security and other systems requirements and work with the technical staff to develop, implement and document technical solutions. Experience with full life-cycle SDLC and implementation of software. Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Writes detailed descriptions of customer needs, system functions, and steps required to develop or modify IT services. Staff Interview experience and techniques in the collection of requirements and documentation. Participate in every aspect of the development lifecycle including sales engineering, requirements gathering, solution architecture, development, testing and deployment. Undertake analysis of user and business requirements, with particular regard to their impact on existing systems and environments and produce an appropriate business and/or system design. Mentor team members in technology, architecture and delivery of applications, and delegate casework. Work as part of a team or leads a team to negotiate new deals, extensions and ad-hoc service aspects. Manage small and large complex problems and in doing so, strengthens the relationship with the client. Recognize when alternative perspectives are required and facilitates appropriate meetings.

**Technical Requirements**
==========================


Develop functional test plans and user acceptance test plans and scenarios. Coordinate functional and user acceptance testing by executing the testing strategy, scheduling resources and tracking test performance. Perform data analysis to support evaluation of system defects or to develop requirements for new functionality; triage and troubleshoot complex user-reported system defects; assist in various system trouble shooting and balancing and correction efforts including analysis, verification and validation of issues and fixes. Conduct impact analysis of technology changes on business processes and existing technology. Facilitate collaborative system and data design sessions with the user community, technical architecture resources and development resources. Assist in the development of data models and interface design specifications. Assist in systems and business process support across multiple client engagements. Coordinate activities including on-time delivery, testing and production moves. Work as a technical support and liaison to designated IT personnel to provide testing, support and feedback on enhancement requests and regular updates/releases; adhere to release schedules. Provide analytical support for critical corporate initiatives including business function support for system migrations and consolidations, significant business area process improvement projects and complex product installations. Demonstrate a high level of subject matter expertise in functional area to bridge business requirements and IT solutions; provide technical direction and ensure compliance with best practice solutions. Practice knowledge transfer and foster change management as the organization changes and new skills are required, focusing on team/individual development to be a valued contributor.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Business Analyst**

**Remote**

Job Responsibilities and Duties

* Review, analyze and document solutions to complex business systems, processes, data, and user needs in partnership with peers and business stakeholders in an Agile environment.
* Analyze and initiate business process improvements and/or business modeling across wide range of processes, data, systems, and business areas.
* Define scope, objectives, and requirements on moderately to highly complex projects. Assist in defining and designing system/business/data requirements and recommend solutions.
* Develop detailed business cases, requirements documentation/user stories, road maps, and test plans in support of business/technical initiatives; with a particular emphasis on data driven solutions (data integration, data visualizations/reporting, enterprise data management, data governance).
* Coordinate and facilitate cross team collaboration efforts for business/technical initiatives with broad impacts and dependencies.
* Assist in managing organizational change as it relates to rollout and adoption of solutions.

Ideal candidates will be:

* Detail-oriented—Nothing gets past you. You make a conscious effort to understand and organize details.
* Collaborative—You know how to leverage strengths of others.
* Problem solvers—You demonstrate diligence, perseverance, and tenacity.
* Innovative/Change Influencer – You stay current and demonstrate a modern approach to solving execution, data quality, business process, and operational risk problems and/or realizing opportunities in those areas.

Job Qualifications

* Strong technical aptitude and advanced business understanding across investment operations functions; exposure to industry applications such as Bloomberg,
* Advanced levels of enterprise analysis and solution assessment/validation.

If you're interested then please send your updated resume at pranjal at technokraftserve dot com

Thanks

title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Remote)
description:
**Business Intelligence Analyst**

  



We’re looking for a highly motivated, detail-oriented, insightful, creative, and experienced analyst with a proven ability to deliver value through analytics.

  

We are based in Austin, TX, but this position is 100% remote.

 **What That Means**

  



You will play a key role in the team responsible for approximately half of the company’s leads and our conversions, which is amongst our most important drivers of revenue. You will achieve this by making a meaningful contribution towards improving our ability to predict operational outcomes, increasing awareness of what's truly important to our success, articulating insights, and culturally promoting data-driven decision-making with regards to how we operate our business. Your responsibilities will include:

  


* Work closely with our SVP of Product and Marketing or SVP of Network Partnerships
* Determine predictive features of business success, align them with behaviors, and make optimization recommendations
* Make business, operational, and pricing recommendations based on data analysis and optimization exercises
* Analyze data from a variety of sources and produce actionable business insights
* Pull in data from multiple sources - collect, review and mine the data, looking for patterns to make the business more profitable
* Build reports and visualizations for stakeholders highlighting “so-what’s” in actionable terms
* Provide intelligence gleaned from experiments and operational adjustments
* Collaborate across multiple teams, including our network of developers and product managers

  

  

**What You’ll Need**

  


* 5+ years of experience working as an analyst, and a proven track record of adding value through analytics
* Clear understanding of the partners you work with, demonstrating a translation of immediate requirements that takes stakeholder-specific subject matter nuances into account
* Demonstration and articulation of when/how you added value for business units
* Advanced capabilities of digging into data at various stages of readiness using SQL and/or Python
* Advanced ability to communicate observations from the data with visualization applications (Tableau, Salesforce, Domo is a plus but not required)
* Strong grasp on statistical concepts with experience putting them into practice
* Experience defining, running and analyzing experiments or tests
* Aptitude for going beyond the data: understanding how a business runs and what drives profit
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with strong attention to detail
* Creative problem-solving mindset
* Well-rounded technological capability (SQL, Tableau, Python, Atlassian, Excel and/or Google Sheets, and Salesforce experience a plus)

  


**What You’ll Get**

  


* Access to robust health, vision, dental, and life insurance plans
* Employer matching 401(k) plan
* Profit-sharing plan
* Generous PTO (Paid Time Off)
* Tuition reimbursement
* Donation matching program
* Paid maternity/paternity leave
* Fitness Reimbursement Program
* Company paid weekly lunches
* Student loan assistance
* Employee recognition programs

  


**Who We Are**

  



Peddle started out of a passion for making selling used cars fast and easy. We love that every used car has a personality, with its share of quirks. We don’t just see busted windshields and broken tail lights, we see road trip warriors, glory days and a vehicle with a story to tell.

  



No matter how used or beat up, we’ll buy it. And we make the process easy and enjoyable because that’s what a modern business should do. We’re people first, cars second. Customer service is what makes our company great. And we follow that with smart technology and design.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
**Business Systems Analyst - Remote, US**


**About Packsize**


Packsize is redefining the way businesses and their customers use and experience packaging around the world. We build the technology, design the right solutions, and automate the processes that propel the industry forward. To us, packaging is much more than a box—it’s delivering what’s right for our customers, their customers, our people, and the planet.


**About the Role**


Packsize is searching for a dynamic Business Systems Analyst/System Administrator with expertise in enterprise systems such as Salesforce, PagerDuty, Infor, and Domo. This role is pivotal in bridging our Information Systems and Operations teams, ensuring optimal integration and support for technical and field services. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in requirement gathering, project management, and a comprehensive understanding of various information systems to enhance operational workflows.


**What You’ll Do**


* Proficient in administering and configuring enterprise systems including Salesforce (especially Service Cloud), PagerDuty, Infor, and Domo, aligning them with IT and operational requirements.
* Skilled in gathering and interpreting requirements, adept at translating operational needs into effective technical solutions within these systems.
* Demonstrated ability to manage projects efficiently from initiation to completion, adhering to timelines, and maintaining high-quality standards.
* Responsible for developing, updating, and maintaining detailed system documentation, striving for continual improvement of processes and system functionalities.
* Capable of juggling multiple projects simultaneously, effectively prioritizing regular tasks alongside unique, situation-specific challenges.
* Expertise in analyzing operational metrics using these systems, identifying key trends, and providing actionable insights for process enhancement.
* Strong problem-solving skills, able to collaborate with various support groups for issue resolution and system optimization.
* Proficient in data visualization and analytics, utilizing tools like Domo and PowerBI to effectively communicate complex data insights.
* Adept at writing basic programming codes in Python or Java, enhancing system automation and efficiency.
* A forward-thinking individual who constantly seeks new methodologies to leverage data for better decision-making and strategic initiatives.

**What You’ll Bring**


* Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
* A minimum of 3 years of experience in a systems analyst or system administrator role, with a focus on Salesforce, PagerDuty, and Infor/SAP
* Experience with Salesforce Service Cloud is highly desirable. Additional experience working with Salesforce Flow, Slack, and PagerDuty integration is also highly valued
* Proven track record in project management and requirement gathering.
* Familiarity with data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, or Domo.
* Strong analytical and operational skills, with experience reporting and interpreting operational metrics.
* Excellent communication skills, capable of effective collaboration across diverse teams and organizational levels.

**Core Competencies We're Looking For:**

* Analytical and Strategic Thinking
* Proficient Organizational and Planning Skills
* Collaborative and Adaptive
* Leadership in Project Management
* Basic Proficiency in Enterprise Systems and Programming Languages (Python, Java)

**What We Offer**


The salary range for this role is **[$80,000 to $100,000 USD]** however, Packsize considers several factors when determining compensation when extending a job offer, including but not limited to, the role being offered, the associated responsibilities, the candidate's prior work experience, education/training, and any special skills.


If this role excites you but you don’t meet each requirement listed, we encourage you to apply anyway. At Packsize, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds and experiences and understand that the best candidates may come from the most unlikely of places.


Packsize is an Equal Opportunity employer and is committed to diversity in its workforce. In compliance with applicable federal and state laws, Packsize policy of equal employment opportunity prohibits discrimination on the basis of race or ethnicity, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, veteran’s status, status as a qualified person with a disability, or genetic information. Individuals from historically underrepresented groups, such as minorities, women, qualified persons with disabilities and protected veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Reasonable accommodations in the application process will be provided to qualified individuals with disabilities.


#LI-AS1

title: IT Business Analyst
description:
**Who You Are**
---------------



You are devoted, compassionate, and enjoy being on the front lines in healthcare, changing the lives of your patients. You are passionate about getting to the root cause of a patient's conditions, removing social determinants of healthcare, and ensuring the highest possible quality of life for those in your care. You don't want to sacrifice quality over quantity, and you aim to provide the same level of care and commitment to your patients that you would to your own family member.


**Does this sound like you?** **If so, we should talk.**

  


**Who We Are**
--------------



We are Honest Medical Group, a groundbreaking team of health care professionals focused on making a major impact in health care. At Honest, we align every aspect of our company to support patients and providers. We are **devoted to purpose** and **inspired by innovation**. We **embrace our communities** and **lead with kindness**. We drive health improvements, create a seamless member experience, and eliminate unnecessary cost. We listen to the needs of our patients and our employees—continually working to push beyond the status quo.


**For us, it's all in an Honest day's work.**

  



**Your Role**
-------------



The IT Business Analyst will be responsible for fostering collaboration across cross-functional teams to pinpoint business requirements, craft effective solutions, and ensure the seamless integration of technology in our healthcare environment. Central to these responsibilities is the production of high-quality documentation artifacts, aimed at ensuring we have a shared understanding of business requirements and proposed technology solutions as we work through the complete design and delivery lifecycle. The IT Business Analyst will also play a key role in optimizing and streamlining healthcare business systems process by leveraging their expertise in system analysis and implementation.


**Primary Functions Include:**
------------------------------


* Act as a liaison between technology and business end-users, working with them to document current workflow processes.
* Collaborate with users to identify, define, and document business rules, process improvement options and alternatives as directed by business needs.
* Translate, simplify, and analyze the feasibility of requirements to enhance business processes and promote efficient solution design.
* Transform conceptual user needs into clear, functional business requirements for development teams.
* Assist in the formulation of business cases, identify required information fields and assist in the development of a data dictionary.
* Collaborate with systems and data services teams to ensure solutions align with business strategies and capability requirements.
* Consult with customers to develop process flows reflecting business process requirements.
* Manage requirements and issues using tools like JIRA.
* Verify that solutions align with specified requirements.
* Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications to project managers, sponsors, and other stakeholders.
* Formulate, document, and verify user stories, acceptance criteria, process flows, and mockups.
* Assist in the design of testing strategies for the implementation of information systems, modules, and subsystems.
* Conduct System Impact Analysis with a focus on both current and proposed states.
* Assist in the development of the technology roadmap, helping align business requirements with system capabilities and data needs.
* Build comprehensive business requirement documents where necessary.
* Effectively communicate complex and/or difficult information to both technical and non-technical audiences in written and oral form
* Perform other related responsibilities as assigned.

  


**How You Qualify**
-------------------



You reviewed the Who You Are section of this job posting and immediately felt the need to read on. This makes you a match for our innovative culture. You accept things change quickly in a startup environment and are willing to pivot quickly on priorities.


* Must have reliable access to high-speed internet to ensure seamless remote work communication and productivity
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field or 4+ years of experience in IT business analysis.
* 3+ years of hands-on IT experience, encompassing all major phases of software implementation projects, including business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and prioritization within healthcare environments
* 1+ year(s) of experience in Agile Methodology, demonstrating adaptability to dynamic project environments.
* Experience with EMRs, CRM platforms, Tableau or other data and analytics tools preferred
* Proficient in Agile tools, with a preference for experience in Jira.
* Strong understanding of project management methodologies, tools, and best practices
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate with diverse teams and stakeholders
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Applications, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Visio
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

**How You are Supported**
-------------------------


* As a full-time team member, you will benefit from Honest's exceptional total rewards package, including competitive base pay with bonuses, paid time off starting at 4 weeks for full time employees, 12 paid holidays per year, reimbursement for continuing medical education, 401k with match, health, dental, and vision insurance.
* As a part-time team member, *y*ou will benefit from Honest's total rewards package, including competitive base pay with bonuses, pro-rated paid time off, paid holidays, reimbursement for continuing medical education, 401k with match.
* Family friendly policies that support paid parental leave and flexible work arrangements
* As a team member you'll be supported by our robust commitment to training and development that starts with onboarding and continues throughout your career with Honest
* You will collaborate with like-minded healthcare professionals who, like you, understand the importance and value of Honest's high-quality, value-based, care model.


Honest is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.



Honest is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to job applicants with physical or mental disabilities. Applicants with a disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process should email talent@HonestMedicalGroup.com for assistance. title: Business Analyst
description:
Bond-Pro is seeking a skilled Business Analyst to join our growing Product Team.


**Who is Bond-Pro:**

  

Bond-Pro is a 25+ year old software company and the leader in providing enterprise software to insurance companies to manage their specialty line of Surety Bonds.

  

We are changing the industry and product management is essential to our mission.

  

Seeking experienced, passionate Product professionals.

  

**What is this Role:**

  

You will improve our product suite by translating market demands and clients' needs into new high-quality features. Your duties will include gathering, analyzing & defining the requirements, analyzing system requirements, addressing any relevant problems, performing standard testing, and chaperoning your assigned features throughout the SDLC to delivery.

  

BSA responsibilities are:

  

* Explore and evaluate current systems
* Define system requirements
* Interact with users to understand their needs and track additional requirements and features
* Work together with the development team to bring features to market
* Analyze changes by testing programs
* Support and train users on new system features, etc.
* Ensure deadlines and requirements are met
* Stay current on market and technical developments
* Become SME for assigned features/areas of the overall product suite


**Who is well suited for this Role?**

  

You should have experience with enterprise software web application development and integration. We seek creative and hardworking people who inspire those around them with their contributions to the team.

  

This position is open to candidates residing in FL, GA, IN, OH, PA, and TX.

  

BSA requirements are:

  

* 3+ years' experience working as a Business Systems Analyst
* Experienced in commercial software development, testing and documentation
* Strong analytical skills and problem-solving skills
* Strong communication skills – able to explain technical details to various audiences
* A bachelor's degree in a relevant area
* Experience in insurance or financial industry, preferably commercial surety bonds
* Understanding of using Azure DevOps or Jira to manage requirements in the Scrum process


This position will be fully remote. The core of the team is based in Tampa, Florida.

  

**Benefits**:

  

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance


**About Bond-Pro**

  

Bond-Pro's fully integrated enterprise software suites enable Surety professionals with a full underwriting suite to evaluate and manage accounts as well as the tools to streamline and automate the entire life cycle of Surety Bonds.

  

Founded in 1991 and headquartered in Tampa, Florida, Bond-Pro is the leading software automation tool for Surety professionals. Our focus is developing state-of-the-art technology solutions to help surety carriers and agencies grow premiums, while reducing risks and operating costs. With 10 major releases and over 250,000 development hours, we dedicate 76% of our operating costs to the further enhancement of our products.

  

Bond-Pro is the most widely used surety automation software deployed by hundreds of agencies and dozens of national surety carriers. Bond-Pro leverages more than 20 years of customer feedback in developing surety software that provides the most feature rich functionality in the marketplace.

  

Learn more about us at www.bond-pro.com (https://www.bond-pro.com/)

title: Technical Business Analyst
description:
· Five (5) years’ experience Business Analyst role

ü A Master’s degree substitutes for three years of experience, or a Bachelor’s degree substitutes for two years, or an Associate’s degree substitutes for one year

· Two (2) engagements lasting more than six (6) months in Business Analyst role

· Two (2) engagements lasting more than six (6) months in Project Manager role

Desired Skills

· Experience with all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)

· Lead BA experience

· Bachelor’s degree in Information Services

· Business Analyst Certification (IIBA certification or equivalent)

· Demonstrated ability to provide leadership, support and assistance in directing and managing program/project development from beginning to end

· Demonstrated ability to clearly communicate program/project plans, expectations, updates, progress, issues, and successes in a timely fashion

Sample Tasks

· Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, event lists, business analysis, competitive product analysis, task and workflow analysis, and/or viewpoints.

· Write requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely. Represent requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, or scenarios, where appropriate.

· Decompose high-level business and user requirements into functional requirements specifying an appropriate level of detail suitable for use by those must base their work on the requirements.

· Identify the current- and future-state business processes; define quality attributes, external interfaces, constraints, and other nonfunctional requirements.

· Lead requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable, and that they conform to standards.

· Participate in requirements prioritization and facilitate the negotiation of requirements amongst multiple stakeholders.

· Analyze and document business requirements and required data to deliver work products throughout the project life cycle.

· Translate business requirements to System/Functional specifications, and pass them on to Application Developers.

· Coordinate Business Validation to verify that a set of end-to-end business processes function as intended.

· Work with the product manager or project sponsor to document the product’s vision and the project’s scope.

· Participate in peer reviews and inspections of requirements documents and work products derived from those documents to ensure that the requirements were interpreted correctly.

· Manage requirements traceability information and track requirements status throughout the project.

· Manage changes to baselined requirements through effective application of change control processes and tools.

· Identify ways to assist product management in product planning through requirements development and analysis. Propose new product features and updates.

· Provide knowledge transfer.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour

* 9 years

Schedule:

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
**Dynamic Solutions Technology, LLC (DST)** is seeking a full time **Business Intelligence Analys**t to provide support for a Federal Government Agency. This is an exempt remote position**.**

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

The position works under the direction of the federal client's Business Intelligence (BI) program. The specific duties include but are not necessarily limited to the following:

* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of best practices in data visualization and BI including but not limited to knowledge of advanced features of Tableau.
* Support and train users at the client-level to implement best practices in Tableau, including developing and delivering content in a classroom setting
* Work with client staff to develop visualization requirements. Develop or support development of dashboards, visualizations and reports based on those requirements.
* Manage BI related user requests
* Field business-related questions through exploratory data analysis and ad-hoc reporting.
* Identify relevant data sources, and manipulate and prepare data for reporting and analysis
* Extract and integrate data from multiple sources including databases in cloud-based or on-premise environments by writing appropriate queries
* Work closely with a variety of technical teams and end-users to identify, diagnose, and resolve technical issues

**Required Skills:**

* Has the required Bachelor's degree plus at least 4 years of relevant experience
* Demonstrates up-to-date knowledge of best practices in data visualization and Business Intelligence, including but not limited to software features and capabilities of Tableau version 2018 or later
* Demonstrates extensive experience developing visualizations with Tableau Desktop version 2018 or later and deploying those visualizations to Tableau Server
* Demonstrates experience identifying, troubleshooting, and resolving complex technical issues on behalf of end users of both Tableau Desktop and Server
* Demonstrates experience working with stakeholders to gather, refine and validate visualization requirements
* Demonstrates experience providing feedback on visualizations (chart type, color choice, titles, layout etc.) to improve efficiency or effectiveness
* Demonstrates experience using Tableau Server and explaining Tableau Server functionality to business users
* Demonstrates experience developing content for and delivering training to others on the use of Tableau or a similar Business Intelligence software in a classroom setting
* Demonstrates excellent communication skills and proven ability to work with business customers and technical teams
* Demonstrates experience leading projects, including tracking progress, developing status updates, and communicating with stakeholders

**Desired Skills:**

* Demonstrates experience developing content for and delivering training to others on the use of Tableau or a similar Business Intelligence software in a classroom setting
* Experience enhancing and automating queries of data sources such as relational databases and flat files
* Experience with training and supporting end users of Power BI
* Experience using data preparation software (like Tableau Prep) to combine or restructure data for analysis
* Prior Government experience in order to expedite the onboarding clearance process.
* Familiarity with the eQIP system and SF86 forms helpful.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst I
description:
**Position Title: Business Intelligence Analyst I**
**Salary Range: $80,000 - $92,000**
**Department: Information Technology**
**Reports to: Manager, Analytics and Research**
**Location: Remote**
**Schedule: M-F; 9-5 EST**
**Formerly the Mental Health Association of New York City (MHA-NYC), Vibrant Emotional Health’s groundbreaking solutions have delivered high quality services and support, when, where and how people need it for over 50 years. Through our state-of-the-art technology-enabled services, community wellness programs, and advocacy and education work, we are building a society in which emotional wellness can be a reality for everyone.**
**Position Summary:**
The Business Intelligence Analyst I works to answer ad hoc questions concerning Vibrant’s programs and internal operations. The role focuses on: answering questions in a timely manner and conducting exploratory analyses that anticipate future questions and needs for the organization.
This role interfaces with business users across the organization to help address emerging data questions. The role collaborates with data reporting and engineering teams to support the development of new tools and system features suggested by incoming questions.
**Duties/Responsibilities:**
* Conduct analyses to answer analytical questions.
* Develop internal tools to facilitate the timely answer of requests using Tableau, Snowflake, or code based analyses.
* Ensure responses to requests are clear, correct, and offer appropriate visualization / explanation to support user understanding of the response.
* Collaborate with Data Reporting and Data Engineering around requirements for new tools and data elements.
* Collaborate with Data Governance roles around data point and metric definitions and use.


**Required Skills/Abilities:**
* Extensive experience with Tableau and other BI tools.
* Ability to conduct analyses in code using Python / R / SQL demonstrated via work examples.
* Experience creating and presenting data-driven insights in a clear and concise manner.
* Experience refining questions with stakeholders to provide high quality analyses.
* Advanced analytic skills.


**Required Qualifications:**
* Bachelors’ or Masters’ Degree in analytics focused discipline or equivalent experience and knowledge.


Excellent comprehensive benefits, including medical, dental, vision, supplemental income insurance, pre-tax transit/parking, pre-tax FSA for medical and dependent care, and 401K available. 4 weeks’ vacation, plum benefits, etc.
*Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they are able to perform every task in the job description. We are most interested in finding the best candidate for the job, and that candidate may be one who come from a less traditional background. Vibrant will consider any equivalent combination of knowledge, skills, education and experience to meet minimum qualifications. If you are interested in applying, we encourage you to think broadly about your background and skill set for the role.*
Vibrant Emotional Health is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants are considered for positions without regard to veteran status, uniformed service member status, race, creed, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, citizenship status, national origin, marital status, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information, caregiver status or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Vibrant does NOT charge any application, processing, or training fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process. All genuine job openings will be posted on our careers page and all communications from the Vibrant recruiting team and/or hiring managers will be from an @vibrant.org email address"*

title: Business Process Analyst (Remote)
description:

Jefferson Consulting Group, a well-respected, minority- and woman-owned small business, seeks a highly qualified individual to serve as a Business Process Analyst. Jefferson provides strategic and operational services to federal agencies in program management, acquisition, human capital and training. The Business Process Analyst will be supporting multiple projects across those domains. This will be a full-time, REMOTE position.

**Responsibilities include:**

* Assist project managers in leading client engagements in strategic planning, operational assessments, requirements development, business process re-engineering, and program management.
* Research, compile, analyze, visualize, and report data for trends.
* Coordinate meetings, conference calls, and track project activities.
* Create, maintain, and adhere to project plans and schedules.
* Develop high quality templates, frameworks, and reports.
* Draft deliverables required under Jefferson’s federal contracts. Examples of deliverables include Performance Work Statements and other requirements documents defining government needs, strategic plans, project charters, organizational assessment reports, business process improvement studies, and summaries and analysis of topics of interest.
* Correspond and effectively and professionally communicate with government officials.

* Support the development and delivery of training.

\\*

* Bachelor’s Degree.
* At least 3 years of relevant experience.

* Excellent organizational, communication, writing, and analytical skills to effectively interact with government clients and industry partners.

title: Business Analyst
description:

Assist in documenting business process flows and rules.

title: Business Data Analyst
description:
Virtualitics, Inc. is an advanced analytics company that helps enterprises and governments make smarter business decisions faster with ready-to-use AI that can be understood–by analysts and business leaders alike. Our AI platform allows organizations to rapidly process complex data into powerful multi-dimensional graph visualizations and predict future business outcomes with clear, explainable, no-code AI modeling. Virtualitics puts AI into use across the enterprise with enhanced analytics that is easily integrated into the flow of work. Our patented technology is based on over 11 years of research at the California Institute of Technology and NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory.


The platform has been deployed across Department of Defense agencies, Federal Civilian agencies, and Fortune 500 companies. We're proud to have been recently named as one of the Air Force's 'big bets' on emerging technology and Built In's top companies to work for in 2022!


Our fast-growing team seeks a skilled, motivated, and reliable **Business Data Analyst** to help grow our company.

  

  

**What you'll do:**


* Select and implement a business intelligence tool to allow the executive team to gain a better understanding of company operations. You will design, develop, and maintain business dashboards to provide actionable insights.
* Reporting to the CFO, you will own the entire business intelligence function: you will be the expert on company data and use that knowledge to answer questions, provide insight, and improve the business.
* Perform ad hoc analysis to solve time-sensitive operational issues and business cases quickly.
* Monitor day-to-day business trends, market conditions, competitor strategies, and client needs, focusing on short- and long-term impacts on key KPIs and business strategies.
* Create and deliver compelling data analysis presentations that explain in-depth insights to an experienced and diverse group of leaders in simple terms.
* Preparing and cleansing large data sets, as required for reporting and analysis.
* Work closely with colleagues across the organization and build strong relationships to drive improvements across the business. Collaborate with GTM and Technical teams to develop metrics and dashboards that support company objectives and key results (OKRs).
* Proactively provide updates on progress and/or blockers when working on tasks and seek out feedback for continued self-improvement.
* Consulting: Provide guidance to stakeholders on how to use data in decision-making

  

  

  

**Your qualifications:**


* 5+ years of experience delivering business analytics and a proven track record of collaborating with a cross-functional team to deliver results.
* 1-2 years of SaaS industry experience required.
* Exemplary analytical problem-solving skills and knowledge of business intelligence tools (I.e., Domo, Looker, Tableau).
* Advanced knowledge of SQL.
* Familiarity with a Modern Data Stack (I.e., ETL tools like dbt, Airflow, Fivetran, and cloud data warehouses like BigQuery, Snowflake, Azure, or Redshift).
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
* Strong attention to detail and excellent written/verbal communication skills.
* Detail-oriented: A strong attention to detail and a well-reasoned sense of skepticism toward the results of analyses.


**What We Offer You**


We are a team of ambitious individuals who are passionate about creating a revolutionary software company. At Virtualitics, you will have a significant career development opportunity and a chance to contribute to one of the fastest-growing startups in Southern California. Our benefits include highly competitive pay, equity, and fully paid health/vision / dental insurance for you + your dependents, and unlimited PTO.


*Virtualitics is committed to building a company where everyone can bring their full impact and reach their fullest potential. Our mission is to build a diverse and inclusive environment where talented people of all cultures, ages, perspectives, opinions, education, backgrounds, races, gender identities, religions, orientations, abilities, and beliefs can grow and thrive with Virtualitics.*

title: RPA Business Analyst
description:
**Position Summary:**  

We have a JOB FOR YOU!!! 100% Remote and responsible RPA Assessments and Process mappings for one of our clients.
  
  

We are looking for an RPA Business Analyst who will be responsible for the identification of automation opportunities, validation, ROI measurement, detailed documentation, and implementation of automation initiatives focusing on process flow, efficiency, and effectiveness. The candidate will lead process improvement and automation projects end-to-end for stakeholders across multiple business lines. The candidate will also be required to assist in the implementation phases and will be responsible for driving the QA testing phase.
  
  

**Job Duties & Responsibilities:**  

* Complete current state assessment of business processes and document each of the following areas in detail: problem statements, process flows, gap analysis, and future-state solution recommendations
* Partner with the process owners to develop a deep end-to-end understanding of processes targeted for automation, and outline the impacted processes and business requirements
* Identify scope, benefits, constraints, and risks for RPA automation initiatives; capture and document current state manual processes
* Create end-to-end cross-functional process flow maps at a high-level as well as at a detailed/modular level
* Maintain and track the potential projects pipeline by working with business users to identify automation ideas
* Participate in presentations that promote RPA to various business groups to further generate automation ideas
* Develop user acceptance test (UAT) plans and tools
* Act as a liaison between business and technical resources
* Perform related and/or additional job duties as required


**Required Experience:**  

* 2 to 5 years of experience supporting business process documentation with business owners
* Knowledge of RPA technologies, such as UiPath or Automation Anywhere, and of best practices for process automation and operational excellence
* Knowledge of user acceptance testing process and procedure, including familiarity with ERP systems and other financial systems
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with the ability to work effectively independently and in a team environment
* Good problem-solving skills
* Good communication skills


**Preferred Skills:**  

* Previous experience working in the public sector with State-, County-, and City-level institutions


**Education:**  

* Bachelor's degree required. Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science or related field.


\\*\\*\\*Must be US Citizen or Permanent Resident

title: Business Analyst -- Fully Remote
description:
Role is Predominantly Remote. Travel is paid for and project dependent.


We are one of the leading minority-owned management consulting firms in the nation. We have worked closely with blue-chip organizations across the public and private sector including local municipalities and state and federal agencies. Our services center around, but are not limited to, capital program development and delivery, transactional advisory services, cross departmental organizational change, IT transformation, and organizational alignment.


Our senior advisers bring a wealth of experience across all sectors. We focus on collaboration with our Clients to architect creative and effective solutions to deliver transformational programs!


**Responsibilities of this role:**

* Set up and facilitate meetings with Stakeholders to understand business processes, pain points, and project requirements
* Understand program needs and document clear and detailed business requirements, including the creation of process flows
* Acts as a translator between the stakeholder and other team members to help the business team understand the client’s vision
* Operate in both an Agile and traditional Waterfall environments while actively supporting deliverable creation and delivery
* Routinely record and send out meeting minutes, decisions, and action items to team members

**Qualifications**

* BA or BS is required
* 2+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or relevant professional experience in a variety of backgrounds and industries
* Experience working in and utilizing various business analysis techniques with Agile and or traditional project management principles
* Experience working as part of a multi-function project team, including interacting and following-up with multiple stakeholders including but not limited to program leaders, SMEs, process owners, IT staff, etc.

**Skills Required:**

* Strong analytical, planning, and organization skills
* Demonstrates strong time management skills and is able to manage competing demands
* Excellent presentation and written communication skills with experience interacting at all levels including at the executive level
* Solid understanding of and demonstrated experience in using project management tools such as PowerPoint, Excel, Microsoft Project, Visio, and all Office tools
* Ability to travel for work as needed
* Willingness to learn new skills and dedicated to self-growth

title: Senior Business Process Analyst
description:
**Position Type :**

Full time**Type Of Hire :**

Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)**Education Desired :**

Bachelor of Commerce/Business**Travel Percentage :**

0%
Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.  

  

**About the team**:


In today’s highly competitive private equity market, firms must not only deliver superior returns, but also respond to more stringent reporting requirements and increasing demands for information – both from within and outside their organization. Throughout the industry there is mounting pressure on organizations to do more, requiring a clear technology strategy that not only addresses the demands of today, but also enables the growth and performance of tomorrow.

**What you will be doing:**

* Demonstrated ability to apply strong analytical skills to effectively problem solve.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Solid mathematical ability
* Demonstrated ability with excel and calculator text to perform mathematical equations.
* Basic knowledge of ERISA guidelines

**What you bring:**

* Solid understanding of the Omni system and transactions associated with adjustments.
* 12 months of prior RPS Operations adjustment or Omni transaction processing experience and/or knowledge
* Ability to work effectively both independently and in a team environment.
* Solid interpersonal skills and ability to effectively collaborate to solve business challenges.
* Excellent organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize accordingly.

**Education Requirements:** Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.

**What we offer you**:

* A range of benefits designed to help support your lifestyle and wellbeing
* A multi-faceted job with a broad spectrum of responsibilities
* An international work environment and a dedicated and innovative team
* An extensive range of personal development opportunities
* A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility and respect

**Privacy Statement**


FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.

**Sourcing Model**


Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.
