title: Market Analyst
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  

Market Risk Reporting is part of Risk Reporting & Middle Office – a group within Corporate Risk responsible for analysis & reporting to internal Risk Management & external parties; monitoring controls and the quality of risk data and execution of strategic reporting projects


In this team you will be responsible for preparation of periodic overviews of key market risk measures like VaR, sensitivities and stress which are used by the Firm's senior management to monitor risk profiles. You will also contributes to external disclosures, i.e. Quarterly Press Release and Form 10-Q/10-K filings along with driving high quality standards through technology innovation, capturing evolving risks and promoting a robust and risk and control environment.

**Job Responsibilities**


﻿* Deliver high quality reporting with effective visualization of key firmwide risks and exposures
* Manage daily feeds, maintain and update reporting templates and procedure documentation, sustain and review data sources including the maintenance of data queries and other aspects of reporting infrastructure
* Identify data quality issues and liaise with appropriate stakeholders for resolution
* Demonstrate effective collaboration with cross functional stakeholders (Market Risk Coverage, Upstream Data Providers, Controls, Technology )
* Contribute to business resiliency initiatives for robust and continued reporting and expansion of additional reporting requirements (e.g Climate Risk)
* Demonstrate ability to execute strategic automation projects from design, implementation to delivery
* Develop understanding of the products and business activities that generate Market Risk

**Required Qualifications, Skills and Capabilities**

* Overall experience of 3-6 years in Risk & Finance is preferred
* B.E/ BTech/ MBA from a premier college or institute.
* Strong analytical skills and control mindset
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint
* Knowledge of Macros and ability to troubleshoot /enhance VBA code

**Preferred Qualifications, Skills and Capabilities**

* CFA or FRM degree preferred
* Experience with Intelligent Solutions (Alteryx; Tableau; Qlik-sense) a plus

title: Program Associate
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**  


* The Transformations, Programs and Governance Team is looking for an experienced associate level candidate to Join our dynamic team as a Project Manager/Business Analyst. In this role, you'll spearhead project planning, coordinate cross-functional teams, and analyze business processes to drive efficiency. Your expertise will be crucial in delivering successful projects, ensuring timelines are met, and aligning initiatives with strategic goals. If you thrive in a collaborative environment, possess excellent communication skills, and have a proven track record in project management or business analysis, we'd love to have you on board!
**Job Responsibilities:**

* Lead and execute complex projects, programs and initiatives from inception through to delivery
* Support the completion of Project Life Cycle deliverables that include documentation of Business Requirements, Design/ Approach, Operating Model, Testing and Production Readiness (as necessary)
* Track project performance, specifically to analyse the successful completion of short and long-term goals
* Act as the bridge between Operations, Technology and Product Development (amongst others)
* Organise and manage communications with stakeholders and senior managers
* Estimate, design and manage the delivery of scalable solutions including Intelligent Automation and Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning aligned to a business strategy.
* Partner with stakeholders at various levels to identify process re-engineering opportunities, create business cases, quantify benefits and identify high priority projects.
* Own process discovery to help identify potential process inefficiencies, find suitable solutions and design the Target Operating Model to improve the client experience and achieve strategic goals.
* Assess regulations impacts across the various dimensions (people, process, systems) and implement changes to meet compliance timelines
* Apply a commercial mindset to deliver efficiently and consistently across teams and the wider organisation
* Use Data Modelling techniques to provide better business intelligence
* Implement process improvement through adoption and creation of industry tools: Alteryx, UiPath, workflow tools

**Required qualification, skills and capabilities:**

* 7-10 years’ experience in project management and agile methodology working on technology related projects
* Understanding of banking products and investment banking
* Strong organizational skills, design thinking and analytical skills including all Microsoft applications.
* Delivering innovative solutions that improve client experience and reduce costs to the firm.
* Detailed oriented, with the ability to manage multiple tasks while maximizing quality of service
* Flexible attitude in dealing with multiple tasks
* Working knowledge in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) as well as new age tools of No-Code No-Code like Alteryx, UiPath, Pega, Instabase, Tableau and Power BI.
* Ability to work under pressure and to deadlines, with accountability and responsibility for owning actions
* Master’s degree and/or PMP certifications will carry significant preference




**ABOUT US**  

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. title: Business Analyst
description:
**Summary**
-----------

  

As a **Business Analyst** at Gainwell, you can contribute your skills as we harness the power of technology to help our clients improve the health and well-being of the members they serve — a community’s most vulnerable. Connect your passion with purpose, teaming with people who thrive on finding innovative solutions to some of healthcare’s biggest challenges. Here are the details on this position.

**Your role in our mission**
----------------------------

  

Play a critical part in ensuring Gainwell is meeting our clients’ objectives in important areas.

* Help coordinate a business analyst team’s duties and activities on IT projects and nurture newer team members by providing guidance and support
* Be a knowledgeable bridge between clients, project managers and technical staff to define, document and share business requirements and expected impact
* Work with the client to develop business specs at the start of a technical project
* Analyze, plan, design, document or make recommendations to improve business processes to support client’s technology goals
* Help verify that all requirements have been met by approving and validating test results
* Exercise your ability to use basic analytical or relational database software — such as Excel or SQL — to quantify the anticipated impact of work
**What we're looking for**
--------------------------

  

* 6 or more years of experience in a relevant Business Analyst position with 3 or more years of Medicaid and Medicare experience preferred
* Knowledge of computer programming concepts such as configuration, development and batch processing
* Advanced knowledge in analytical software such as Microsoft Excel or SQL and other requirement-mapping tools such as Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools
* Strong client communication skills translating client needs to actionable objectives
* Strong analytical and business process re-engineering skills
* Strong executive presence and communication skills to deliver messages to business leaders, clients and technical personnel
* A leader who motivates others to action and communicates key technical ideas in a digestible way
**What you should expect in this role**
---------------------------------------

  

* Hybrid Office

title: Salesforce Consultant
description:
### **Job Information**


Industry


**Technology**Work Experience


**4-5 years****Remote Job**


### **Job Description**


This is a remote position.


We are currently seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Business Analyst to join our team.This position entails the dual role of a Business Analyst who collaborates closely with the Product Owner/Customer on requirement gathering, business value assessment, and defining success metrics. Additionally, this role involves managing project delivery utilizing both sprint and waterfall methodologies

  

  

Responsibilities

  

* Understand the business requirements from the stakeholders and converting the real-world business problems into technical solutions and limitations.
* Analyze current business processes and identify areas for improvement or automation. Work closely with stakeholders to understand their requirements and business objectives.
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and document detailed business requirements. Translate business needs into technical specifications for Salesforce configuration or customization.
* Design Salesforce solutions that align with business requirements and best practices. Recommend solutions that maximize the use of standard Salesforce functionality and minimize customization.
* Design and implement data models, data migration strategies, and data quality processes. Ensure data integrity and accuracy within the Salesforce system.
* Develop test plans and execute testing activities to ensure that Salesforce solutions meet quality standards and business requirements. Coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) with stakeholders.
* Stay updated on Salesforce platform updates, features, and best practices. Identify opportunities for process improvement and system optimization.
* Good skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency.
* Experience in at least one enterprise agile tool, such as JIRA (preferably), Version One, Rally, or TFS.
* Should be flexible and adaptable to complex situations. Maintain overlapping hours with US work hours to collaborate with client.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce capabilities, best practices, and limitations and the ability to communicate those to key stakeholders.
  
  

  

### **Requirements**


Qualifications

  

* 4 years of overall experience with 3-4 years of relevant experience front end Salesforce Configuration and customization
* Knowledge of APIs, LWC components general scripting and automation, writing triggers , batch classes on various objects like flows
* Experience with integration architecture to support downstream and upstream data transfer
* UG: BE / BTECH
* Salesforce Business Analyst / Salesforce Certified Admin certification
  
  

  

  

  

### **Benefits**


Joining us offers a range of benefits aimed at providing a conducive and rewarding work environment for our employees. Here are some of the advantages you can expect:

  

* Flexible Work Environment: We understand the importance of work-life balance, and our flexible work environment allows you to manage your workload in a way that suits your personal needs and preferences.
* Prompt Salary Disbursement: Your hard work deserves timely recognition, and we ensure that your salary is disbursed promptly on the last working day of each month, providing you with financial stability and peace of mind.
* Customized Training Opportunities: We offer a variety of training programs, workshops, and resources to support our employees' ongoing learning and development. These opportunities cover a wide range of topics, including technical skills, leadership development, communication, and more.
* Paid Leaves for Family Time: We value the importance of spending quality time with your loved ones. Enjoy paid leaves that enable you to cherish precious moments with your family without worrying about work commitments.
* Secure Your Family's Health: We prioritize the well-being of our employees and their families by offering a comprehensive group medical insurance policy. This ensures that you and your loved ones have access to quality healthcare when needed.
* Accident Coverage: Your safety is our priority. With our accident coverage, you can have peace of mind knowing that you and your family are protected in the unfortunate event of an accident.
* Hassle-Free Maternity Insurance: Welcoming a new member into your family is a joyous occasion, and our hassle-free maternity insurance ensures that you can focus on the arrival of your little one without worrying about financial burdens.
* Accessible Leadership Team: Our leadership team is committed to fostering an environment of open communication and support. We make it easy for you to reach out to us with any concerns, ideas, or feedback, ensuring that your voice is heard and valued.
* Inclusion: We strive to cultivate an inclusive environment where every employee feels valued, supported, and empowered to contribute their unique talents and perspectives. We actively promote collaboration, communication, and mutual respect among team members, fostering a sense of belonging and camaraderie.

By joining us, you not only become part of a dynamic and inclusive workplace but also gain access to a range of benefits designed to enhance your overall well-being and satisfaction. We strive to create a positive and supportive work culture where every employee can thrive and succeed.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**Duties and Responsibilities:*** The position relies on excellent judgment to plan and accomplish goals and must be a self-starter
* Excellent individual problem-solving and analytical skills are needed for day today work
* Pre audit and post audit preparation
* To be a part of discussions with audit teams and stakeholders
* Handling items to closure and scope finalization
* Follow up with internal teams and related stakeholders
* Track of end-to-end deployments and finding exceptions post deployments
* Provide support to cross-functional teams in getting the work completed within timelines
* Decisions are expected to be made independently with minimal oversight and a high degree of accuracy
* Explore new tools and techniques which can help minimize work efforts and streamline the processes
* Work with data to understand patterns and anti-patterns to determine exceptions


**Experience and competencies:*** Exposure to audit related activities, conducting, data analysis and drafting observations and responses
* Excellent written and spoken English skills and an ability to compose a grammatically correct, concise, and accurate written response
* Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate complex transactional issues correctly and clearly to both internal and external customers
* Demonstrated ability to work independently and make complex decisions with little to no guidance
* Excellent problem-solving skills
* Demonstrated ability to analyse problems logically
* Self-disciplined, diligent, proactive, and detail-oriented
* Strong time management and organizational skills
* Effectively prioritizes work time to ensure productivity and fulfil department standards for time spent
* Excellent ability to determine situational needs and provide appropriate solutions
* Demonstrated ability to exceed expectations about performance and individual contribution
* Have a good understanding of Insurance, products, and processes
* Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to recognize non-obvious patterns


**Skills competencies:*** Experience with Microsoft Excel (expert level), PowerPoint and Outlook
* Hands on experience in analysing data sets, trend analysis
* Ability to interpret data and organize information
* Basic understanding of SQL database

title: Senior Supply Chain Analyst
description:
**Service Supply Chain Business Partner > SSCBP Planning > SSCBP Supply & Inventory Planning**

  


At Vestas, SSCBP - Service SIOP (Sales, Inventory Operations Planning) we are constantly optimizing the service supply chain in order to deliver on time to our customers, and at the same time have an optimized supply chain with low inventory and efficient set up. It is an ever developing task in a professional environment. Planning has the responsibility to define delivery concepts and network setup to meet customer requirements, forecast and planning for all materials for the service business, inventory management maintaining optimal inventory level across the value chain, and project management of continuous improvement initiatives within supply chain.

  


**Responsibilities**


* The right candidate will have hands on experience in a global supply chain function within the forecast and planning area of a distribution network
* Improving Inventory turn over ( ITO) and Material Availability (OTIF) through Analytical reasoning of the root causes and corrective measures
* Keeping track of material consumption patterns, Replenishment lead time and Forecast fluctuation and mitigating the risks in case of deviations
* Ensuring lean initiatives & Process improvements
* Typically, the day in vestas, SSCBP, SIOP will be spent on evaluating the safety stock, forecast, mitigating the stock out risks, Root cause analysis on the on-time delivery misses, Collaboration with various global stakeholders

  




**Qualifications**


* Graduate in Engineering /post graduate in any stream having experience in Demand -supply planning and Balancing
* 3-5 years of experience from a global international supply chain function within production, Material planning and spare parts /service environment
* Hands on experience in applying supply chain principles and methods including reporting
* Solid experience in inventory planning in a global distribution network

  




**Competencies**


* Good knowledge in SAP (MM, SD module specifically), MS Excel
* Ability to understand the Master data parameters and its implications on the planning side
* Methodical approach towards problem solving and Basic statistics knowledge
* Ability to understand the complex supply chain network and its intricacies
* Good verbal and written communication skills in English, stakeholder management skills
* Supply chain certifications ( eg: APICS-CPIM , CSCP ) preferred but not mandatory
* Working knowledge in SQL is preferred but not mandatory

  

  

**What We Offer**

  

We offer an exciting job with great opportunities for professional and personal development in an inspiring environment at an established producer of wind turbines. We highly value initiative, responsibility and the right balance between creativity and quality in all solutions. You will become part of a highly professional environment with a professional business commitment. Our working environment is informal, and you will get a unique opportunity to influence your own position in a rapidly developing environment.  


**Additional Information**

  

Your primary workplace will be in Chennai.  

Please note: We do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date. Please be advised to apply on or before 31st March 2024.

**About Vestas**

  

Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.  

 Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 145 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.  

 With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.  

 Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.  

 To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.
